column2: Worth the time to take a look.
column3: If you are the kind of person who appreciates beautiful craftsmanship from the past, you will find a piece of it here.

It's always good for the soul to take a step back in time. This is an active station, but if you look around at the building inside and out and then close your eyes, you can transport yourself to a time when travel by train was the only decent way to get anywhere!!!
Here, one can easily imagine excited young students arriving by train to start the academic year. It's good that Claremont has preserved its history.

We've passed this beautiful train station many times while riding the metro link train heading for Union Station in Los Angeles. We finally decided to take a look around on a recent car trip to Claremont. This historic building is well-maintained. We didn't get a chance to check out the art museum inside. There's a tall clock tower that faces the train tracks. This station is just a short walk from downtown Claremont.

column2: Beautiful Train Station with a Museum right next door.
column3: Ride the train from San Bernardino to Los Angeles UnionStation and stop in Claremont for some yummy food or Friday night music!

column2: Exterior is cool-- interior only on weekends...
column3: Used to be the train depot, but now a metro link station.Interior is now an art museum but Only open fri,sat and sun.Kinda a cool building, wish I was here on the weekend to see the art museum insideAverage and a drive by.
Came by expecting a working train station, but there are no people selling tickets behind a counter. It's a beautiful building but right now there's nothing there except the facade. Disappointing.

column2: Can't wait for the art museum!!
column3: I'm becoming a Tripadvisor junkie lol, so when I knew I was going to Claremont I wanted to see something I could only find there. We didn't have a lot a time so stopping by the old train depot. It's really pretty but what was exciting was to see that they are renovating it for an art museum. It looks like a beautiful building and I can imagine it will only get better with this museum. My wife and I also really liked that there was a history of Claremont on the side of the building.
Nice station. Close to the village. My son liked it too. Station is being remodeled for a museum. Overall enjoyed it alot!

column2: Great that we still have a train!
column3: The "Metrolink" isn't the most reliable service in LA Country, but it's great that it still exists. Claremont's historic train station is beautiful in and of itself--as a local, I highly recommend using it :).

column2: This town has certainly change over the years
column3: Now it has several large, well known colleges. I spent lots of time here, volunteering with the Kiwanis club to clean up the "welcome to Claremont" sign area, work on the park and even was a guest once at the President of Claremont College's home for an event. Lots more to see in the town.

column2: Simple and Nostalgic Link to the Past
column3: This is a wonderful glimpse of what Old California may have been like, indeed. I rode in with my kids and grandkids on the Metro. What a blast! Within walking distance are many great restaurants and my favorite place - the Folk Music Center! Check it out!

column2: We ought to have more like this....!!
column3: I grew up in Glendale, CA and Pasadena, CA where the train stations were as beautiful as they were useful. This one so reminded me of those two. They do not build places like this anymore, so it is a walk through the heritage of Claremont and the east San Gabriel to tour this station, which once not only anchored the town but was in the center of the citrus industry.A person of any age could enjoy this station...and hey, take a ride!!

Claremont Heritage offers tours of historic Claremont that meet in front of the depot on the first Saturday of each month at 10:00. Until I took that tour, I didn't realize the significance and influence of the depot. Well worth the $5. It's a beautiful building, restored largely to it's original condition...including the lovely tiles lining the walls.

Watched over the years as it went from a working train station to falling into disrepair to it's current glory. History tells of a time when it was the local citrus train stop with the now renovated packing plant a block away. A great representative of time long passed building.

column2: Come See Claremont's Old Train Station :)
column3: This is Claremont's old train station. It served to anchor the town and became a hub of the transportation to the area. It is a beautiful old depot, the building has been preserved and the current metrolink is next to it. Would be nice to have it used more! Santa comes at Christmas time and other various things happen but could be utilized more! Let's find a good use for this grand building!

column2: Not much there just a cool old building
column3: Would not go out of my way unless you were a huge train enthusiast. It is a cool old building but, that is about all that is there. Neat architecture but small overall.
